name: Azim (actor)
content:
Azim (1937 – 26 March 2003) was a Bangladeshi film actor. He is best known for his role in Rupban (1965) as Rahim Badshah opposite Sujata.[1]
 Azim was born in 23 July 1937 in Habiganj, Bangladesh as 'Nurul Azim Rauf Khaled'. He debuted in the 1960 film Rajdhanir Buke. In 1961, he appeared in Harano Din. He appeared in cult hit Rupban in 1965. Later, he appeared in several films in the 1960s and 1970s. Banglar Nayok was his last film. He appeared in a total of 53 movies.[2]
 Azim married actress Sujata on 30 June 1967.[3][2]
raw:
Bangladeshi film actor
AzimBornAzim Rauf Khaled23 July 1937Habiganj, Assam Province, British IndiaDied26 March 2003(2003-03-26) (aged 65)OccupationActorSpouse(s)Sujata ​(m. 1967)​
Azim (1937 – 26 March 2003) was a Bangladeshi film actor. He is best known for his role in Rupban (1965) as Rahim Badshah opposite Sujata.[1]

Contents

1 Career
2 Personal life
3 Works
4 References
5 External links


Career[edit]
Azim was born in 23 July 1937 in Habiganj, Bangladesh as 'Nurul Azim Rauf Khaled'. He debuted in the 1960 film Rajdhanir Buke. In 1961, he appeared in Harano Din. He appeared in cult hit Rupban in 1965. Later, he appeared in several films in the 1960s and 1970s. Banglar Nayok was his last film. He appeared in a total of 53 movies.[2]

Personal life[edit]
Azim married actress Sujata on 30 June 1967.[3][2]

Works[edit]
Rajdhanir Buke (1960)
Harano Din (1961)
Natun Sur (1962)
Paise (1962)
Bewaqoof (1962)
Rupban (1965)
Mala (1965)
Chena Ochena (1967)
Beder Meye (1969)
Tansen (1970)
Santan (1970)
Mishor Kumari (1970)
Takar Khela (1974)
Protinidhi (1976)
Banglar Nayok (1995)
